AdditionalFields.Value: Population Sciences,Cancer Disparities,Prevention / Early Detection / Interception

Description: Recent trends in cancer epidemiology demonstrate an increase in early onset of colorectal cancer that has led to an earlier recommendation to commence screening. There are longstanding differences in risk and newer observed changes in risk for specific racial/ethnic populations for early-onset colorectal cancer. This session will highlight those epidemiological changes, plus explore our current understanding of the causative drivers that have led to the observed increases in early-onset colorectal cancer as a whole and for specific racial/ethnic groups.
Location: New Orleans Theater A, Convention Center
SearchResultBody: FO08. What Is the Causal Link between Race and Early Onset of Colon Cancer?
SearchResultFooter: New Orleans Theater A, Convention Center
Title: What Is the Causal Link between Race and Early Onset of Colon Cancer?
